metadata.Title: CVE-2021-1799 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A port redirection issue was addressed with additional port validation. This issue is fixed in macOS Big Sur 11.2, Security Update 2021-001 Catalina, Security Update 2021-001 Mojave, tvOS 14.4, watchOS 7.3, iOS 14.4 and iPadOS 14.4, Safari 14.0.3. A malicious website may be able to access restricted ports on arbitrary servers.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-1799` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.30.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.30.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.30.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.30.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.30.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.30.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.30.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Gregory Vishnepolsky, Ben Seriy, and Samy Kamkar

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
webkit2gtk package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.30.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
